title_sort: john m. rogers to walt whitman, 26 december 1872
title: John M. Rogers to Walt Whitman, 26 December 1872
text: BrooklynDec 26 1872Dear friend and Fatheras it is snowi[snowy] here tonight I was looking of some letter I came acrost[across] one of your letter and as it some time cince[since] I have not seen or heard from you I thought I would write a few lines to you. I am as well as can be and am getting very Stout but how do you do and are you well and how do you get along this cold weather it has been very Cold here I am now employed at the Contentatual[Continental] Bank Note Co and I get alon[along] very nicely do much better than I did with the wood CoLast Sunday we had very large fire in Brooklyn Dr. Talmage Church in Schwirharn St. was destroyed and some very large fire in New York, by Barnum's Museum, and a larg[large] Printing Co in Center St but I supose[suppose] you have heard of it by this now I will close with loveI remain yourJohn M RogersAddressJohn M RogersDffield Brooklyn John M. Rogers to Walt Whitman, 26 December 1872
